result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary L Meenen Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: -Consecutive to any other sentence and to commence immediately.

superMiscConds.notes: -Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

-No Contact with the victim Andrea W.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Gary L Meenen Jr
Current: PO Box 925, C/O Redgranite Correctional Institution, Redgranite, WI 54970 United States  (Effective: 03-10-2020)
Prior: 571 County Road A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States
Revoked, sentenced to prison - 10/21/2019
of Sentencing on Revocation held on October 21, 2019, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Karen Blair - Court Reporter

1:06 p.m. Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - thought that Atty Zamzow was representing the defendant.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Defendant has received a copy of the sentencing after revocation paperwork, with no corrections, additions or deletions, just the time.  State has received a copy of the sentencing after revocation paperwork, with no corrections, additions or deletions. DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA Christenson.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

3 years Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision, to be consecutive to any other sentence and to commence immediately.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

-No Contact with the victim Andrea W.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
-Court costs - 618.00.  Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Court grants the defendant 724 days of sentence, unless defendant can show that amount is not correct.

Court finds the defendant eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

Court adjourned at 1:15 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 21, 2019 at 01:00 pm.
Inmate Request to the Court - Signed and denied by Judge
of Conviction - Extends probation for 1 year (10/13/2019) or until obligations are paid in full

1:05 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Agent Mike Pulice not present in court.  Statement by defendant - has not paid anything on this matter.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:07 p.m.
from Agent Mike Pulice dated 09/14/2018 re: payment history
Probation review hearing on September 17, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
11:06 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 as repeater and counts 2 & 3 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Wilsnack concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as a repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Wilsnack.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-court costs
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

Court adjourned at 11:14 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-13-2015 10:00 am

9:41 A.M.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Jon Wilsnack present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - requests a plea & sentencing be scheduled.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on October 13, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:42 a.m.

10:40 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - had the chance to go over the proposal and requests another hearing.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on August 31, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:41 a.m.

9:02 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Wilsdnack and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Wilsnack enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.

By Atty Jon Wilsnack

Status hearing on March 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

No Contact with Andrea W.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  EXCEPTION - Contact as allowed under the CHIPS case.

2:02 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as a repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Andrea W.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Court will set for Status Hearing on March 10, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Statement by DA - requests the defendant be released on these charges, defendant is on a probation hold.  Court doesn't find probable cause and releases the defendant on this charge.
